intro: Spiraea chamaedryfolia var. ulmifolia, commonly known as the European meadow spiraea, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and western Asia. It features slender, arching branches that bear clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers in early summer. The leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a smooth texture and a serrated margin. This plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, moist soils. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
